results.title: Santa Claus: the movie
results.creator_credit: Jeannot Szwarc, Alexander Salkind, Ilya Salkind and Alexander Salkind Productions
results.brief_description: A live action film about Santa Claus, his elves and how one nasty rich man attempts to stop Christmas. The elves leave the Arctic to join Santa’s fight to bring back Christmas to all the children of the world. With Dudley Moore and John Lithgow.

results.title: Nicholas and Alexandra: war and the fall of the Czar, 1914-1917
results.creator_credit: Franklin J. Schaffner, Sam Spiegel and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Western Civilization”.
Shows the intertwining of Russia’s war policy abroad with her chaos at home. Tells how Nicholas went to the front with the army, leaving Alexandra to rule and how she thought only of her son’s possible cure. Ends with Czar’s abdication. Uses excerpts from the film “Nicholas and Alexandra (1971) starring Michael Jayston, Janet Suzman.

results.title: Nicholas and Alexandra: the Bolshevik Victory, 1917
results.creator_credit: Franklin J. Schaffner, Sam Spiegel and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Western Civilization”.
Covers the October Revolution and shows the radicalisation, counter revolution and civil war. Explains that Lenin returned to Russia, promising peace and a new socialist order. Shows how Kerensky became powerless and ends with the Czar’s execution. Uses excerpts from the film “Nicholas and Alexandra (1971) starring Michael Jayston, Janet Suzman, Jack Hawkins, Ian Holm to tell the story of the Bolshevik victory.

results.title: Nicholas and Alexandra: prelude to revolution, 1904-1905
results.creator_credit: Franklin J. Schaffner, Sam Spiegel and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Western Civilization”.
Focuses on the years 1904-1905. Shows some of the causes of the Russian revolution that were visible more than a decade before Lenin arrived at the Finland station. Reveals the extreme contrasts of Russia, the role of the Czar, the workers, the revolutionaries and the peasants. Uses excerpts from the film “Nicholas and Alexandra (1971) starring Michael Jayston, Janet Suzman, Laurence Olivier.

results.title: Pal Joey
results.creator_credit: George Sidney, Fred Kohlmar, Essex and George Sidney Productions
results.brief_description: Pal Joey, starring Frank Sinatra, Kim Novak and Rita Hayworth, is strong, funny entertainment based on a novel by John O’Hara. It features 14 songs from Rodgers and Hart including “The Lady is a Tramp”, “Bewitched, Bothered and Bewildered” and “My Funny Valentine”. Sinatra is an out of heel nightclub singer, Joey Evans, who plays the field with women. He is ideal as the irreverent, glib Joey.

results.title: Gloria
results.creator_credit: John Cassavetes, Sam Shaw and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: An accountant in possession of a ledger that could convict a number of Mob “bosses” entrusts both the ledger and his son to Gloria for protection before being murdered. Reluctantly she takes the child and begins a life on the run while keeping the mob at bay. Gena Rowlands gives an outstanding performance in the title role that earned her an Oscar nomination.

results.title: The Purple rose of Cairo
results.creator_credit: Woody Allen, Charles H. Joffe, Jack Rollins and Robert Greenhut
results.brief_description: Trapped in a dreary marriage, Cecilia escapes to the cinema and in particular to the romantic adventure “The purple rose of Cairo”. Then one night as she watches the film the hero, Tom Baxter, steps out of the screen and into her life. But where does that leave the other characters - indeed the whole film? The real-life actor who played Tom is in danger of his career being finished, the producers see only lawsuits coming their way. Pandemonium sets in as real life clashes with fantasy. A bitter-sweet comedy starring Mia Farrow, Jeff Daniels and Danny Aiello. Best film 1985 British Academy Awards.

results.title: Flight of the doves
results.brief_description: Constantly bullied by their cruel stepfather, Finn Dove and his young sister Derval decide to run away and find their grandmother in Ireland. They are chased by their wicked Uncle Hawk, a master of disguise, who is aware that the children are heirs to a fortune. Features Ron Moody, Jack Wild and Helen Rayne. Based on the book by Walter Macken.

results.title: The Adventures of Tom Sawyer
results.creator_credit: Norman Taurog, David O. Selznick, William H Wright and Selznick International
results.brief_description: In this story, we meet Tom, his aunt Polly, his cousin Sidney, girlfriend Becky, and his best friend and adviser Huckleberry Finn. Tom seems to be constantly drawn to trouble. His dangerous adventures, schoolboy pranks, and his painful cousin are highlights of this video. Based on the novel of Mark Twain.
